required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of IBI939 in Combination With Sintilimab in Patients With Advanced NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Phase I Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of IBI939 in Combination With Sintilimab in Patients With Advanced Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study is an open-label, phase I clinical study to evaluate the efficacy, tolerability and safety of recombinant fully human anti-TIGIT antibody (IBI939) in combination with recombinant fully human anti-programmed cell death receptor 1 (PD-1) antibody (sintilimab) in subjects with advanced lung cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with complete response(CR) or partial response(PR).

secondary_outcome.description: The time from randomization to the first occurrence of objective disease progression or death
The time from randomization to death due to any cause.
Proportion of subjects with complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD).
The time from the first documented objective tumor response(CR or PR) to objective disease progression (PD) or death.
Time from randomization to first objective tumor response (CR or PR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC)
